title: Went on a Harry Potter tour it ended here wonderful stop
text: I loved seeing a store at Kings landing tube stop backed go early in the morning so your not outside waiting to get in.

title: friendly employee's beautiful sculptures
text: I absolutely glad I did this I have wondered what an ice bar looks like, and it had wonderful sculptures it was beautiful and the girls there super duper friendly.

title: loved going hands on science museum with a show of the northern lights
text: I totally enjoy places like this I am a child at heart and I came here to see the northern lights so I had to see the show.

title: small and homey
text: I enjoyed walking through the museum but I am a museum person, if you expect something big grand you will be disappointed I wasn't.

title: I didn't go inside but beautiful on the outside
text: Many people outside of this establishment, it was to expensive to me to go inside and eat a meal but we loved the movie so we had to go at least see it from outside.

title: so blessed to have seen this in real life
text: I am telling you if you out of shape like me it isn't the easiest climb but the 80 year old lady I saw climbing embarrassed me to the top!!!! I can imagine how amazing this once was, high on a hill overseeing their city.

title: So close to the wolves you could touch them
text: I am crazy about wolves so this was perfect for me. I think they should have a way to get up and down the hills though if your older like I am it was a trek.

title: Gorgeous place due to delayed transport I missed my tour time and was told too bad by female staff
text: It was awful for me because I was late for my tour and their was NO flexibility. The hill was tough to climb and the horses were very slow. I waited in line over an hour for horse thinking it was plenty of time it was night. It was the saddest part of my trip as I went very far out of my way to get here and at great expense. It was the number 1 thing I was looking forward too. I met a tour guide who I hoped would just let me join her she said late too bad.

title: We went to see Alladin paid 400.00 for 4 seats in the nose bleeds still worth it!
text: I wanted to make sure this visit that I went to a play I wanted to see I had 2 of my grandchildren with me 13 and 9. We chose Alladin because it was a 50.00 a person cheaper but we all totally loved it. My granddaughter is interested in acting so I thought what a way to experience it. Great choice. Loved the Genie and Jafars sidekick. The flying carpet scene was heavenly.

title: We took an electric bike ride/a person was guiding us it was 50.00 for 45.00 mins
text: I am so happy we did this as central park is a huge place and we had already been walking so much I was happy to pay for a break and some direction. Only sad thing for me is I didn't see alice in wonderland and didn't get to drive the sailboats :( The guides were from Tajikistan working their ways through college and were wonderful, I wish I remembered their names I am horrible but it was totally worth it. We were 4 each had 2 and it was a total of 100.00

title: Granddaughter the pizza connoisseur had to have the best and I was told this was it.
text: We had to find the best pizza join in Manhattan to make my granddaughter happy she is 13. We had a couple of other pizza's all to horrible reviews, this place made the whole family happy. They are friendly and the same price as every other pizza place 22.00 for a large cheese.

title: Friendly workers crappy tour
text: I have to tell you they are friendly and nice. However they have a terrible route, they drop you off far from the attractions, the gps recording doesn't give enough information was very disappointing. Also they had many attractions missing from their tour. The map showing attractions was no where near as detailed as other hop on off tours I have been on in the past. Pick Grayline or Bigbus. Oh and for rain or heat no roof, we roasted like chickens.

title: We went to the Met for the Mummies and art 9 and 13 year olds with us
text: I think we all totally enjoyed the museums I wasn't sure I was going to come here until I was at the Natural Museum and they wanted 100.00 for 4 of us to see their Mummy exhibit. I knew the Met had its own and its pay as you wish. I wished 4.00. And we got to see master's art and the Mummies to make my grandson happy. Wish I had more time in it gorgeous place

title: amazing wonderful go after 8pm for half off
text: We saw this by day and by night. I loved it, my family enjoyed it. Seeing everything at night, we got the 15.00 Ipad to show us everything I think its worth it I liked the details it gave we rented just 1 and all used it. The elevator is amazing. We paid 20.00 for a picture for all of us but everywhere we go I buy 1 professional picture for posterity. Go you'll love it

title: Its free and the views of the statue and the city are breath taking
text: I love this free thing do I love seeing it because my family came through Ellis Island its a very touching thing for me. Imagining being 15 years old alone but to meet some cousins not knowing the language and the first thing I see is Lady Liberty.

title: Not what I expected
text: Long drive and walk up the hill I had high hopes as my grandmother had told me she liked it. However the big museums offer so much more. It was very religious, Christian somehow reminded me of a cemetery.

title: My granddaughter had to see the lights
text: Its big its bold. I think this is where New Yorkers get their attitude of grandeur. The place is glorious, light up like christmas, no place like it.

title: Great spot if you like museums remember its pay what you wish, not as they wish
text: You need a couple of days or a whole day going through this and the Met. We went to all the animals things, I had to see the whale, the kids all the animals.

title: We only walked by it on our way to other adventures but it looked very nice
text: This park looked full of people plenty of places to sit, greenery and chess/checkers tables. I wish we had time to stop and relax there.

title: We stopped in to print something but glad we did
text: We made the mistake of thinking we could print something our plane tickets here. Even though its not a good place they still helped us. We saw wonderful art on the walls, and the famous reading room while there. Oh and a bathroom on every floor.

title: We stayed here in a hostel called Royal parc
text: I felt totally safe in this neighborhood. We stayed here due to prices. No frills. There was plenty of spots to eat and drink and close to the subway.

title: Best meal of my trip
text: Loved our food and it was so inexpensive. I decided to try things I never have before because it was so inexpensive to do it. I loved the dumplings, the kids loved their lo mein, husband loved his beef and brocolli, Ioved it too.

title: We only saw it from the outside but its Iconic
text: We ended up going to world trade center 1 because they had the better price. I still think of New York and there are a few things that come to mind and Empire State building is one of them.

title: If you love churches you will love this.
text: I am so sorry due to my crappy tour I didn't get to see this, this time but I have in the past and if you like churches the way I do, this is one your not going to want to miss just for its grandeur. Its beautiful.

title: Took the grandbabies had a great time
text: I would of given this a 5 if they would of allowed my 13 year old granddaughter to do what she was begging to do swim with the whale sharks. You need to have a parent until age 18 and 500.00 was too much for me to shell out to have her dream come true, wish it was a more reasonable 16 years old. She has swam with so many other animals already, from Rays to Dolphins. However for my 2 younger grandbabies we enjoyed every area. Our favorite was the touch tanks of course later I was reminded of the Finding Dory movie but even for me it was the most fun. We loved the Rays the most my grandson was afraid and got over it too. We especially enjoyed the friendly Rayshark. He/she really loved a cuddle. The penguin tube is also inventive and fun. We have seen plenty of Dolphin shows but this one was really great its nice to see human interaction with dolphins when the animal rights folks have stopped it in other places. Was wonderful. totally recommend.

title: Wow a kids wonderland
text: We had a rainy day that stopped our plans for sledding so we needed to find something else to do with the grandbabies and the reviewers were right this is a beautiful little spot for 10 and unders. Even our 13 year old found ways to have a good time too, even though its not geared to that age group. It was packed but we went on a Saturday filled with birthdays boys and girls. We loved the wide variety of things to do, we loved the age area's for safety. The one thing they need to do is have staff watching kinds on the inflatable slide in the back some folks have no common sense and put their very small children on it and its dangerous. Other then parents lacking sense we loved it. They had Elmo, and Olaf and Mickey come to visit great place.

title: Oh Mama Mia that's a tasty and BIG pizza
text: We were sick of McDonalds and but wanted something the kids would all please eat. This was very close to our hotel and it said New York style so we went for it, I haven't seen a pizza this big this full of pizza for 20 years. This is the old fashioned stuff of my childhood when a slice filled you not like you get today. Lots of pepperoni, and cheese hmmm hmmm good!!!

title: This was is so great they need to set up more signs for us tourists, in Wyoming I missed it the first time we went.
text: This was a well maintained little spot, part drive through to see wolves, bears and other animals, with a small area of amusement ride, a petting zoo. They have an educational area. And let me not forget the Moose. Both my elder grandchildren got to feed bears they switched off every person in the group to feed each bear cub in which their were 6 in total it was a total blast, they even give you a souvenir picture of it. Totally fun, unique and at an amazingly inexpensive price for everything we go and how well we were treated.

title: This place is beautiful stay if you want stop if in area.
text: They have all kinds of wonderful things to do and they are organized and have a board showing you all the things you can do. Yellowstone should have such clear attraction board. We stopped and had a bite to eat, we were Moose searching that day and decided we needed to eat and have a drink and were done. We go outside on the beautiful veranda and what do we see people oohing and ahhing, well nosy rosy has got to know, sure enough a Moose Mamma and her baby...Yeah, food and Moose and other friendly tourists. Beautiful place.

title: Breathtakingly beautiful-do the Ranger Tour
text: I can't recommend coordinating your trip with Free ranger tours. Do the Junior ranger stuff if you have kids it makes it more fun for the kids, heck if they allowed it I would do it. We visited this alone and it was gorgeous, but really gave it more appreciation when you understand things and that is the ranger tour makes it a richer experience to have a guide. Lots of families we went in late August.

title: So beautiful but so HOT go in early morning
text: I think its GORGEOUS but we went in late summer and I felt sick it was so hot. I was the only one in my group to walk. So go late evening or early morning to the heat won't get ya.

title: A wonder for a reason
text: Beautiful but again very hot if visiting late summer and mid day, go and see this amazing geographical wonder early morning or later in evening.

title: A animal wonderland
text: My grandkids, husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Lodge because it was closest to Lamar Valley we would hit it morning and evening. Sometimes your stuck in a herd of buffalo, and sometimes up on the slopes. Prong horn sheep, look like something off the african plane. Wolves and I got to say it was such a thrill, the naturalists with their high powered scopes and the nicest people ever. They were always so helpful and gracious and let us look through their scopes to see the best scenes, in our case it was a pack of wolves with a buffalo it sounds horrible but it was super thrilling for us city folks. My grandkids have 2 favorite trips, Alaska and Yellowstone :)

title: Buffalo and Wolves what's not to like
text: Lamar and Hayden valleys are the places for wildlife. You just watch for stopped cars to know where to find them. And luckily there is alot to stop for. Eagles, chipmunks, buffalo, some parts elk. We were most thrilled by Wolves but saw out of naturalists who shared their telescopes with us. We did not see bears on this trip but did go to the west entrance to a animal reserve/animal rescue and saw the biggest bears in the world. Kodiaks and upclose wolves totally worth the trip, but it on the list of things to do. Don't say I didn't warn ya.

title: Really enjoyed this, airboat ride and a small but good variety of other animals
text: I got a groupon to go here and I must say it was better than I imagined. We did go out and see some gator but it was perfect timing, not to long not too short. I do recommend not going in the heat, as there isn't any shade. The wide variety of animals in there animals exhibits was shockingly wide. We pet a baby gator, and watched a gator show. Then walked around and saw cool animals like panthers, leopards, and a fenniac fox. Many more its been a while and I can't remember them all but I do remember thinking man this is cool why didn't I do this sooner.

title: nice hands-on museum for kids with movie theater
text: My children now my grandchildren enjoy this place. One area in need of renovation in the back, things need to be a little easier to do and understand sometimes but I do enjoy it when I go.

title: sweet little place
text: Nice spot to take your kids for a couple of hours. Only downside was the tours they have except for a simple class about otters is for 12 and up this kind of wrecked it for us as we had read such good things about the octopus tour, didn't dawn on me to check ages? The employee's very helpful, we enjoyed it. Purchased the northern lights book of coupons, and got in b1g1

title: very picturesque
text: I loved it's look we took 2 cruises while in Seward, the harbor was very pretty loved the colorful mix. End of day they have catch of the day pictures on the pier for free/your own camera of course.

title: Excellent we saw it all but another cruise was a little better
text: The staff and trip, we took the 9 hour morning tour and had an excellent captain talk about maneuvering he was amazing, and excellent at finding animals we saw all of the great stuff Orca's, birds, humpbacks, dall porpoise, sea otters, sea lions. However I enjoyed another cruise more because I felt nickled and dimed on this one. Want a coffee/tea/hot chocolate/binoculars its all extra, we paid a hefty fee for this cruise, when we went on another cruise line Major Marine this was complimentary and a welcome change because its pretty darned cold on that water.

title: Great trip loved the extra's, Highly recommend
text: We a family of 4 went on 2 cruises with Kenjai and Major Marine I think both excellent for the cruise itself. However I enjoyed Major Marine more because they didn't nickle and dime us, we got free tea/coffee and binoculars in case you forgot yours. Very warm and friendly they are the smaller of the 2 not in ship size but company size but I enjoyed the extra's. Oh and one other thing I really appreciated was 3 bathroom stalls for women vs only 1 on the other cruise line.
place: Major Marine Tours - Kenai Fjords Cruise

title: the kids loved it
text: I enjoy a little more personal touch so I went with the sled dog kennel that was a little less established in fact I learned that Travis and Sarah used to work for the larger Seavey Kennel down the road. I only got on the ride for a little as I felt there were too many heavy people for the dogs, they seemed to be laboring after a wild, and exhilerating start. I don't blame the dogs I blame weight but after a few thrilling round abouts they seemed to be struggling. I think this needs to be taken into consideration next time. For the time I was on it, and my grandkids were THRILLED, Justin not Travis was one of our hosts, very young and kind man. The puppies adorable, the ride a rush. I asked a ton of questions and all were answered, I love learning. Best of luck to you in the future! Oh one recommendation besides the weight issue for the ride is you are really missing out on revenue by not having some husky stuffed animals, keychains and postcards as add on's. :) OH and a real bathroom vs outhouse yikes.

title: Glad I did it but man wish I had gone with a group
text: I am a city person so I was kind of nervous about bears to begin with, although there were plenty of people at different spots. I felt like a mountain goat going straight up at some points but am glad I did it. Recommend the walk and bringing bug spray the bugs are HUGE.

title: got close, glad I did it, but wasn't easy
text: I would go with a ranger if I ever did this again. I kind of felt nervous during some of it with it's drop off's and a 6 year old with no attention span

title: should of taken the cruise
text: We drove to the visitors center and saw the glacier and my first blue ice floating in the water. I loved it. THe kids took turns telling us what shapes the ice was in I thought it was beautiful. I am sorry I didn't take the portage glacier tours I met another couple down in Seward who did and said they saw all kinds of wildlife, that is why I didn't do it because I wanted to see wildlife not just ice. My mistake. Spent 5 dollars at museum at the base of the glacier I enjoyed it, kids free.

title: Don't miss it
text: We loved it. It was our first live animals we had seen, had seen some stuffed one's in the airport, seen some dead one's on the side of the road. The area the animals are in is huge so I loved it so much more than a Zoo, sometimes a zoo can be a big depressing they have such little space. We loved seeing, caribou, lynx, bison, elk, the bears, Used the northern lights coupon book for a buy one get one, oh and I loved the gift shop.

title: Flower heaven
text: We had a coupon for the tram so we took a hike, went up the tram, visted the gift store, and saw some of the most amazing flowers ever. This area had the best smelling air I have ever smelled, something so fresh I wish I could of bottled it, it was amazing.

title: good thing its so close to the road would of missed it
text: The best part of this, is the tour of the place. I am terrible with names but the woman who is a part owner with her tour of the place its, chickens, ducks, geese, tortoise and rabbit and garden really made it worth the stop not mining for gold, really enjoyed it.
place: Indian Valley Mine, National Historic Site

title: Really enjoyed, what dog sled rides 10.00? unheard of need to let folks know. Few improvements recommended for you.
text: Loved the tour and all the information given at each hut/dwelling. Excellent presentation by someone named John, I believe he said he was a Yupic? Wish we had gotten there sooner it was that good, however I have quite a few recommendations that I think would vastly improve there center. 1. Clothing the native clothing warn was so generic, there is such gorgeous native clothing to be worn it was so disappointing so see their clothing so bland, and it should be representative of each culture. 2. There was a health/medicine informational and it never explained native american medicine, I went to all of them/phones and none of them explained it in any detail, I think native american medical center would be amazing but it never got explained well. The dog sledding I had no idea it was there I could of saved a large sum of money and would of come sooner had I known you had $10.00 sled rides what a deal, I have kids I guarantee if you advertised this more, more of us with children would run not walk to save money. Only recommendation for the sweet girl with the team, is maybe a better set up to hold puppies so both kids/puppies safer than just a child's arms. Oh and gift shop, I know you want to be authentic but things made out of ivory are out of the budgets of many, some cheaper items would help you. Loved it all though.

title: After heritage center I had deeper appreciation for artifacts I saw here
text: I loved that it had a planetarium, hands on stuff for kids, and the native american artifacts area...amazing wonderful stuff!!

title: very nice but not much wildlife at the time I went
text: I went to early in the day to see much its a beautiful boardwalk but oddly placed near a gun range going off all the time?

title: Nice little gem
text: When we went it was raining so many of the animals were trying to stay dry so we didn't see them in their dens. They had a lovely variety of animals to visit for us the wolves were the best as we had not seen. I enjoyed seeing very upclose the animals we had seen in denali or on a cruise. Highly recommend.

title: good for all ages
text: I saw just as many adults playing as kids, it was nice that they had a planetarium too. I thought having an area for toddlers brilliant.

title: HUGE
text: huge forest, lots of trails to hike. Traveled anchorage, girwood to seward. Beautiful mountains. Lots of spots to stop and rest or check out scenary.

title: Didn't get to see the whole thing, but still man oh man
text: I remember looking around wondering where in the heck this mountain was amoung all these mountains. HA HA, didn't look high enough. Thank goodness my husband had a ranger show him, otherwise we never would of looked high enough. I am sorry I didn't see the whole thing but just the piece that peeped showed it's immensity.
placeLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska

title: They give you these amazing backpacks for your kids
text: They had a small little museum nice, and a wonderful bookbag full of cool stuff for kids, guides for animals and flowers we had a blast with just the flowers, testing water, and ground and water temps and things to draw with....good stuff
placeLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska

title: kids and husband saw plenty of animals
text: I couldn't do it but hubby and kids brought back some great shots of caribou and grizzly with 2 cubs and other animals they were so excited it was wonderful.
placeLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska

title: waiting for the rest of fantasyland to be finished, beautiful visually
text: Well we got lucky and had a rather cool, day the lines were really long. I almost feel like I should of gotten there at 8p.m. the park really slowed down at that time, and cooled off. The day was filled with super long lines but it was a gorgeous day. We went beginning of March. Visually the area in fantasyland with Ariel/Belle's area's. I went on the Ariel ride I really liked it very gentle.; grandaughter felt it should of had a little more of how the Seawitch was defeated. There is a beautiful tower for Rapunzel as you had to the Haunted house, besides being visually beautiful especially at night I am wondering what are they going to do with it? Snow White isn't open yet, it seems it needs more rides they made beautiful area for shops/food where are the rides maybe I missed something?

title: Across the street from Weeki watchee, excellent price
text: I was nervous about last minute plans to travel over the 4th of July weekend but this was a great rate. My husband and I wanted to take our grandkids to a couple of old florida attractions that are still open that our parents took us to as kids.

title: Old Florida charm
text: We came back here with our grandkids as our parents and grandparents brought us. We didn't catch the show you have to be in line 30 mins early and we didn't plan well enough. We did go to their spring fed water area called Buccaneer Bay as my grandson just couldn't wait for a show. The water is pretty chilly, I only but up to my belly before I quit. The kids did get used to it, there are 3 water slides and its part of the park price which is only 13.00 and kids 5 and under are free. Excellent prices. My grandson overcame his fear of heights slid down the slides. And a manatee swam within feet of us. It was the most thrilling part of the trip for us actually. You can go down and do a lazy river but a real river.

title: nice atmosphere
text: I like the animals and the cool sounds. We bought some kids plates and toys. Nice theme and they have a day when kids eat for less so we went.
